page.title: 10Changes in Welham Green.
page.content: A local resident remembers the Welham Green of 30 years ago as having one village shop-cum-post office.Today there is a parade of shops and the village has grown five times in size. The development began in the fifties with the building of a housing estate. It has continued to grow ever since. Welham Green is the largest industrial village in Britain. The industrial complex stretches along the railway. One site (now a timber yard) was used as a First World War POW camp. Local clubs include:Albion Football Club, North Mymms Cricket, Tennis and Bowls Clubs and a Working Men's Club. Behind the St. Thomas More Church, the community centre is a base for a wide variety of activities for all age groups and the village hall is usually fully booked.
